fields.content_fr:
I Definitions

§1. The following rules specify the conditions of use of CivilHub.org, in particular the rights and obligations of registered users.

§2. The following rules apply to:

2.1 Terms of Use - should be understood as a set of rules defining the rights and obligations of the users and CivilHub.org, the terms of protection of personal data, as well as rules defining the responsibilities of CivilHub.org as the provider of services.

2.2 CivilHub.org - should be understood as an organization that connects people to the joint implementation of local ideas and projects. The main aim of the organization is to promote public participation in local areas of the world.

2.3 User - should be understood as a natural person who by registering accepts the these Terms of Use. The user is given access to the services offered by CivilHub.org.

2.4 Profile - should be understood as a place in CivilHub.org where a collection of user information obtained during registration is published.

2.5 Accounts - should be understood as a set of data which confirm being a user of CivilHub.org. By entering a username and a password, you get the ability to modify the data published in this profile and the ability to modify your account.

2.6 Administrator - should be understood as the person responsible for managing CivilHub.org.

II Conclusion and termination of contracts for the provision of electronic services

§3. A CivilHub.org user may only be an individual who is 13 years of age or older.

3.1 You can become a member of CivilHub.org if you have the capacity to act or if you have the consent of the legal representative in the case when you have a limited capacity to act.

§4. In order to use the services offered by CivilHub.org it is necessary to create an account. An account is created by filling out the registration form with the necessary personal information.

§5. Filling out the registration form, account creation, the use of services offered by CivilHub.org and the publication of information is absolutely free.

§6. By registering an account, you agree to all terms of these Terms of Use and you are agree to comply with them.

§7. In case of withdrawal of your consent on any of the conditions, you are obliged to remove your personal account or to inform the administrator about your withdrawal.

§8. A service contract is concluded electronically at the time of the fulfillment of the registration form by you and by accepting these Terms of Use.

8.1 The contract is concluded for an indefinite period.

8.2 Either party may terminate the agreement without cause immediately.

8.3 You terminate the contract by deleting the account or by notifying the administrator about your wish to delete the account.

8.4 CivilHub.org terminates the contract through the administrator by deleting your account.

§9. CivilHub.org reserves the right to remove your account at the time of violation of these Terms of Use or the Privacy Policy.

§10. CivilHub.org reserves the right to modify any of the services provided but will inform the users about any changes on its blog and in the Terms of Use in the case when the changes would affect these Terms of Use.

III Registration and Account

§11. The Registration process involves completing the form available on the CivilHub.org website.

11.1 By accepting these Terms of Use when registering you declare that you have read and you agree with the content of these Terms of Use and that you confirm the authenticity of the data provided during registration.

§12. A properly conducted registration is possible only when the following information is provided: user name, first name, last name, e-mail address and password. When deleting the data you lose the ability to use the services.

§13. In case of misrepresentation, the administrator has the right to block or delete your account.

§14. In the case when your account was blocked, you have no right to create another one without the permission of the CivilHub.org administrator.

§15. You can create only one personal account.

§16. It is forbidden to share your account with other people.

§17. It is forbidden to use accounts that belong to other users.

§18. It is forbidden to create an account for another person without his/her permission.

§19. You are obliged to take care of reliability and timeliness of your data.

§20. During the creation of your account you can add a picture, on the condition that it represents you and that it is not vulgar.

20.1 The CivilHub.org Administrator reserves the right to remove photos without your notice if they are considers inappropriate.

20.2 A stubborn adding of inappropriate pictures will result in the removal of the user's account.

20.3 It is forbidden to share any unauthorized commercial communications, such as SPAM at CivilHub.org.

IV Responsibility and Safety

§21. CivilHub.org is not responsible for the content and form of the materials and information published at CiviliHub.org by the users.

§22. It is forbidden to publish at CivilHub.org content or performance of any activities that contravenes or violates the rights of another person, or are otherwise contrary to law.

§23. CivilHub.org reserves the right to remove any of your contents or informations if it is incompatible with the following terms.

§24. CivilHub.org is not responsible for the content of messages sent between users.

§25. You are fully responsible for breaking the law, and the damage caused by your actions at CivilHub.org.

§26. CivilHub.org is not liable for damages resulting from failures and interruptions in the functioning of CivilHub.org

§27. CivilHub.org does not guarantee a proper functioning of CivilHub.org as a whole or any of its part.

§28. It is prohibited to affix and distribute the CivilHub.org computer passwords, access codes, content, abusive, illegal or morally reprehensible breach of common decency.

§29. It is forbidden to perform any operations that could disable, overburden, or limit the proper functioning of the CivilHub.org.

§30. It is forbidden to use CivilHub.org for illegal, misleading, malicious or discriminatory purposes.

§31. CivilHub.org does not allow content that promotes hate, contains pornography, threats or contains nudity or drastic violence.

§32. It is forbidden to publish at CivilHub.org the identity of other persons and confidential financial information.

§33. It is forbidden to use the data made available by CivilHub.org for advertising purposes.

§34. CivilHub.org will not transfer user data to advertisers without their consent.

§35. CivilHub.org reserves the right to disclose your personal data if they are necessary to address legal obligations, legal requirements, to resolve disputes or to enforce the rules or these Terms of Use.

V Copyright

§36. By placing data, materials or statements at CivilHub.org you agree that they may be used, for personal use, by other users.

§37. By publishing your songs or any other contents at CivilHub.org you disclaim all of your copyrights to this content.

§38. You take full responsibility for adding any materials, images or information.

VI Final Provisions

§39. CivilHub.org reserves the right to change these Terms of Use without giving any reasons for such changes.

§40. CivilHub.org will notify you if the changes made to these Terms of Use relate directly to you.

§41. CivilHub.org will notify about the changes in these Terms of Use by publishing the amendments with their respective date.

§42. You are fully responsible for submiting an incorrect or inactive e-mail address therefore disallowing you to receive notification about any changes to this Terms of Use.

§43. Your continued use of CivilHub.org after any changes in this Terms of Use of in the Privacy Policy will be regarded as acceptance of these changes.

§44. CivilHub.org reserves the right to remove any advertisements without giving a specific cause.

§45. The data administrator is CivilHub.org Aperto Sp. z o.o. located on 10 Jasna, 00-013 Warszawa KRS number: 0000444048, NIP number: 5272692210, REGON number: 146623535

fields.content_pl:
I Definicje

§1. Poniższy regulamin określa warunki korzystania z CivilHub.org, w szczególności prawa i obowiązki zarejestrowanych użytkowników.

§2. Poniższy regulamin dotyczy:

2.1 Regulaminu - należy przez to rozumieć zbiór przepisów określających prawa i obowiązki użytkowników jak i CivilHub.org, zasady ochrony danych osobowych, jak i również zasady określające zakres odpowiedzialności CivilHub.org z tytułu świadczenia usług.

2.2 CivilHub.org - należy przez to rozumieć organizację, która łączy ludzi w celu wspólnej realizacji lokalnych pomysłów i projektów. Głównym celem organizacji jest propagowanie partycypacji społecznej w lokalnych obszarach świata.

2.3 Użytkownika - należy przez to rozumieć osobę fizyczną, która poprzez rejestrację konta i akceptację regulaminu uzyskuje dostęp do usług oferowanych przez CivilHub.org.

2.4 Profilu - należy przez to rozumieć miejsce w CivilHub.org, gdzie opublikowany jest zbiór informacji o użytkowniku uzyskanych podczas rejestracji.

2.5 Konta - należy przez to rozumieć zbiór danych, które potwierdzają bycie użytkownikiem CivilHub.org. Poprzez podanie loginu oraz hasła użytkownik dostaje możliwość modyfikacji danych opublikowanych w profilu oraz możliwość modyfikacji konta.

2.6 Administratora - należy przez to rozumieć osobę odpowiedzialną za prowadzenie CivilHub.org.

II Zawieranie i rozwiązywanie umów o świadczenie usług drogą elektroniczną

§3. Użytkownikiem CivilHub.org może być osoba fizyczna, która ukończyła 13 lat.

3.1 Osoba fizyczna może zostać użytkownikiem CivilHub.org, jeśli posiada zdolność do czynności prawnych lub też posiada zgodę przedstawiciela ustawowego w przypadku gdy posiada ograniczoną zdolność do czynności prawnych.

§4. W celu korzystania z usług oferowanych przez CivilHub.org niezbędne jest założenie konta. Konto zakłada się poprzez wypełnienie formularza rejestracyjnego, w którym należy podać niezbędne dane osobowe.

§5. Wypełnienie formularza rejestracyjnego, utworzenie konta, korzystania z usług oferowanych przez CivilHub.org oraz publikowanie informacji jest całkowicie bezpłatne.

§6. Rejestrując konto użytkownik wyraża zgodę na wszystkie warunki niniejszego regulaminu i zobowiązuje się do ich przestrzegania.

§7. W przypadku wycofania zgody na jakikolwiek z punktów regulaminu użytkownik jest zobowiązany do osobistego usunięcia konta lub powiadomienia administratora o wycofaniu zgody.

§8. Umowa o świadczeniu usług drogą elektroniczną zostaje zawarta w chwili wypełnienia przez użytkownika formularza rejestracyjnego oraz zaakceptowania regulaminu.

8.1 Umowa zostaje zawarta na czas nieokreślony.

8.2 Każda ze stron może rozwiązać umowę bez podania przyczyny w trybie natychmiastowym.

8.3 Użytkownik rozwiązuje umowę poprzez skasowanie konta albo zgłoszenie usunięcia konta administratowi.

8.4 CivilHub.org rozwiązuje umowę poprzez skasowanie konta użytkownika przez administratora.

§9. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do usunięcia konta użytkownika w chwili naruszenia regulaminu oraz polityki prywatności.

§10. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do dowolnej modyfikacji świadczonych usług, a o zmianach poinformuje użytkowników na własnym blogu i regulaminie, jeżeli zmiany miałyby wpływ na treść niniejszego regulaminu.

III Rejestracja i Konto

§11. Rejestracja polega na wypełnieniu formularza dostępnego na stronie internetowej CivilHub.org.

11.1 Użytkownik akceptując regulamin podczas rejestracji oświadcza, iż zapoznał się i zgadza z jego treścią oraz potwierdza autentyczność danych podanych podczas rejestracji.

§12. Poprawne przeprowadzanie rejestracji użytkownika jest możliwe tylko i wyłącznie poprzez podanie następujących danych: nazwa użytkownika, imię, nazwisko, adres e-mail i hasło. W przypadku usunięcia tych danych użytkownik traci możliwość korzystania z usług.

§13. W przypadku stwierdzenia podania nieprawdziwych danych przez użytkownika administrator ma prawo zablokować lub usunąć konto.

§14. W przypadku zablokowania konta użytkownik nie ma prawa utworzyć kolejnego bez zezwolenia administratora CivilHub.org

§15. Użytkownik może utworzyć tylko jedno konto osobiste.

§16. Zabronione jest udostępnianie swojego konta innym osobom.

§17. Zabronione jest korzystanie z kont należących do innych użytkowników.

§18. Zabronione jest tworzenie konta dla innej osoby bez jej pozwolenia.

§19. Użytkownik jest zobowiązany dbać o rzetelność i aktualność swoich danych.

§20. Użytkownik tworząc konto może dodać do profilu zdjęcie pod warunkiem, że przedstawia jego osobę oraz nie przedstawia treści wuglarnych.

20.1 Administrator CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do usunięcia zdjęcia użytkownika bez jego powiadomienia jeśli uzna, że jest ono niewłaściwe.

20.2 Uporczywe dodawanie zdjęć o niewłaściwej tematyce będzie skutkować usunięciem konta użytkownika.

20.3 Zabronione jest udostępnianie nieautoryzowanych komunikatów komercyjnych np. spamu w CivilHub.org.

IV Odpowiedzialność i Bezpieczeństwo

§21. CivilHub.org nie ponosi odpowiedzialności za treść i formę materiałów i informacji umieszczonych w CiviliHub.org przez użytkowników.

§22. Zabronione jest publikowanie na CivilHub.org treści lub wykonywanie jakichkolwiek czynności, które naruszają lub łamią prawa innej osoby albo są w inny sposób sprzeczne z prawem.

§23. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do usunięcia dowolnej treści lub informacji podanej przez użytkownika, jeśli będzie ona sprzeczna z poniższym regulaminem.

§24. CivilHub.org nie ponosi odpowiedzialności za treści wysyłane w wiadomościach pomiędzy użytkownikami.

§25. Użytkownik ponosi pełną odpowiedzialność za złamanie prawa oraz szkodę wywołaną jego działaniami w CivilHub.org.

§26. CivilHub.org nie ponosi odpowiedzialności za szkody powstałe w wyniku awarii i przerwy w funkcjonowaniu CivilHub.org.

§27. CivilHub.org nie udziela gwarancji prawidłowego działania CivilHub.org w całości lub w części.

§28. Zabrania się umieszczania i rozpowszechniania w CivilHub.org haseł komputerowych, kodów dostępu, treści obraźliwych, bezprawnych, nagannych moralnie lub naruszających powszechnie dobre obyczaje.

§29. Zabronione jest wykonywanie jakichkolwiek czynności, które mogłyby przeciążyć, wyłączyć lub ograniczyć prawidłowe funkcjonowanie CivilHub.org.

§30. Zabronione jest wykorzystywanie CivilHub.org do celów niezgodnych z prawem, wprowadzających w błąd, złośliwych lub dyskryminujących.

§31. Zabronione jest publikowanie treści które promują nienawiść, zawierają groźbę lub pornografię, zawierają elementy nagości a także drastyczną przemoc.

§32. Zabronione jest publikowanie na CivilHub.org dowodów tożsamości innych osób i poufnych informacji o charakterze finansowym.

§33. Zabronione jest wykorzystywanie danych udostępnionych przez CivilHub.org w celach reklamowych.

§34. CivilHub.org zobowiązuje się do nie przekazywania danych użytkownika reklamodawcom bez jego zgody.

§35. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do udostępnienia danych osobowych użytkowników w przypadku jeśli są one niezbędne do rozwiązania zobowiązań prawnych, wymogów prawnych, rozwiązania sporów lub wyegzekwowania regulaminu i polityki ochrony prywatności.

V Prawa autorskie

§36. Użytkownik poprzez umieszczenie danych, materiałów lub wypowiedzi w CivilHub.org wyraża zgodę na wykorzystywanie ich przez innych użytkowników w zakresie ich osobistego użytku.

§37. Użytkownik publikując w CivilHub.org treści o charakterze utworu autorskiego zrzeka się wszelkich rozszczeń względem CivilHub.org z tytułu nieodpłatnego wykorzystania tych treści.

§38. Użytkownik bierze pełną odpowiedzialność za dodawane przez siebie materiały, zdjęcia oraz informacje.

VI Przepisy końcowe

§39. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do zmiany regulaminu bez podania przyczyny takiej zmiany.

§40. CivilHub.org zobowiązuje się do powiadomienia użytkowników o zmianie regulaminu, jeśli zmiana dotyczy bezpośrednio tej osoby.

§41. CivilHub.org zobowiązuje się do powiadamiania o zmianach w regulaminie, poprzez opublikowanie daty ostatniej zmiany regulaminu.

§42. Użytkownik ponosi pełną odpowiedzialność za podanie adresu mailowego nieprawidłowego lub nieaktywnego i wiążące się z tym nie otrzymywanie powiadomień o zmianie regulaminu.

§43. Dalsze korzystanie z CivilHub.org po wprowadzonych zmianach w regulaminie i polityce prywatności będzie jednoznaczne z zaakceptowaniem tych zmian.

§44. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do możliwość usunięcia reklamy bez podania konkretnej przyczyny.

§45. Administratorem danych CivilHub.org jest Aperto Sp. z.o.o. z siedzibą przy ulicy Jasnej 10, 00-013 Warszawa o numerze KRS: 0000444048, NIP: 5272692210, REGON: 146623535.

fields.title: Privacy
fields.content:
1. Basic principles

This privacy policy applies to CivilHub.org and all registered users and visitors of the portal. CivilHub.org reserves the right to make any changes and to notify users about them via the website. You have the right to delete your account after such changes. Further use of CivilHub.org after such changes will mean accepting them.

CivilHub.org's mission is to enable users to exchange views on the actions and activities that take place in local communities. The portal gives you the opportunity to propose citizen ideas for changes in the surrounding communities and to transform these ideas into action. One of our main goal is to maintain trust to the website and the organization. We respect the privacy of our users. Your personal data is protected and without the user's consent it is not made ​​available to third parties, the Company or any other government non-government organization. An exception to this is a legal requirement, court order or other legal procedure in force in the Republic of Poland. The data administrator is CivilHub.org Aperto Sp. z o.o. located on 10 Jasna (street), 00-013 Warsaw, KRS number 0000444048, NIP number: 5272692210, REGON number: 146623535.

2. Collecting information

2.1 Collecting information

Account Registration involves completing a registration form available on the main page or on the subpage of registration on CivilHub.org. A properly conducted registration process involves the usage of real user data (user name, first name, last name, e-mail address, password), reading and accepting the rules and the privacy policy. In the case of misrepresentation, the Administrator has the right to block or delete your account. You may only be a natural person when you are 13 years of age or older. After completing the registration form you will receive activation link on your e-mail address after clicking on the link, the account activation will be complete.

2.2 Profile

Once you have created your account, you can add a profile picture and supply more information about yourself that information is visible to all users. You shall not share information you don’t want to share publicly. A complete profile will enable you to find other user in CivilHub.org faster and easier.

2.3 Cookies

CivilHub.org uses cookies to improve the quality of service, enhance security and in the future to provide advertising profiled for you. By visiting CivilHub.org you agree for the placement of cookies and beacons on your browser in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

2.4 Search

Each user has the ability to search for information about other members of the portal, groups, initiatives, locations, ideas and discussions on the portal.

2.5 User communication

CivilHub.org is not responsible for the content sent between users. We reserve the right to block your account if you send unsolicited messages (SPAM) to other users of the portal.

3. Rights and obligations of the user

3.1 The right to change information and to delete your account.

You have the full right to modify, alter, correct or delete completely your account for any reason. There is also the option to delete your account by the administrator at your request or if you do not respect the principles set out in the Rules and the Privacy Policy. If you delete the user account, the account will be deleted in 72 hours. Your profile may show up in the search results until you refresh your browser.

3.2 Principles of data storage

The information given by you is stored during the time when the account is active or if necessary CivilHub.org can store your data after removing the account and CivilHub.org can make the data available if it is needed to solve legal obligations, legal requirements, resolve disputes or to enforce our Privacy Policy. The period of storage of users depends on the legal requirements.

3.3 Obligations of the user

You should follow the rules and conditions set in the Rules and the Privacy policy. This also applies to intellectual property rights, copyrights and trademarks.

You are required to maintain the confidentiality of your password. Publishing information that is regarded as offensive, violent, racist or which may violate our goal, mission or the community of the users is prohibited. Failure to comply by a user to the aforementioned rules may result in removal, suspension or blocking of the account.

4. Important Information

4.1 The minimum age

As specified in the Rules, to use CivilHub.org you must be a natural person in the RP and you must be 13 years of age or older. The minimum age to use the site may be different depending on local law in the country from which the user connects to the portal.

4.2 Security

CivilHub.org stores all data, with the exception of passwords, as a plain text in the database, maintained on its own or leased servers. Sensitive data like passwords are encrypted, rendering them impossible to read it.

4.3 Changes to the Privacy Policy

CivilHub.org is obliged to inform of any changes made in the Privacy Policy in the homepage footer of the portal. The Privcy Policy will contain the date of the last made change.

fields.content_pl:
1. Podstawowe zasady

Niniejsza polityka prywatności dotyczy CivilHub.org oraz zarejestrowanych użytkowników i osób odwiedzających portal. CivilHub.org zastrzega sobie prawo do wprowadzania zmian i powiadamienia o nich użytkowników za pośrednictwem strony internetowej. W przypadku zastrzeżeń użytkownik ma prawo usunąć konto. Dalsze korzystanie z CivilHub.org po wprowadzonych zmianach będzie oznaczało zaakceptowanie wprowadzonych zmian.

Misją CivilHub.org jest umożliwienie użytkownikom wymiany poglądów na temat działań i aktywności odbywających się w lokalnych społecznościach. Portal daje możliwość zaproponowania przez obywateli dowolnych idei dotyczących zmian w otaczającej nas społeczności oraz przekształcania tych idei w konkrentne działania.

Jednym z naszych głównych celów jest podtrzymywanie zaufania użytkownika do portalu i organizacji, dlatego sami przestrzegamy zasady ochrony prywatności użytkowników. Dane osobowe użytkownika są chronione i nie są udostępniane bez jego zgody osobom trzecim, firmom ani żadnym innym organizacjom rządowym lub pozarządowym. Wyjątkiem jest wymóg prawny, nakaz sądowy lub inna procedura prawna obowiązująca na terenie Rzeczypospolitej Polskiej. Administratorem danych CivilHub.org jest Aperto Sp. z.o.o. z siedzibą przy ulicy Jasnej 10, 00-013 Warszawa o numerze KRS: 0000444048, NIP: 5272692210, REGON: 146623535.

2. Gromadzenie informacji

2.1 Rejestracja

Rejestracja konta polega na wypełnieniu formularza rejestracyjnego dostępnego na stronie głównej lub podstronie z rejestracją na CivilHub.org. Prawidłowo przeprowadzony proces rejestracji wiąże się z podaniem prawdziwych danych użytkownika (nazwa użytkownika, imię, nazwisko, adres e-mail, hasło) oraz przeczytaniem i zaakceptowaniem regulaminu i polityki prywatności. W przypadku stwierdzenia przez administratora podania nieprawidłowych danych użytkownika, ma on prawo zablokować lub usunąć konto. Uzytkownikiem CivilHub.org może być tylko i wyłącznie osoba fizyczna, która ukończyła trzynasty rok życia. Po uzupełnieniu formularza rejestracyjnego użytkownik otrzyma na podany adres e-mailowy link aktywacyjny, po kliknięciu którego nastąpi pełna aktywacja konta.

2.2 Profil

Po utworzeniu konta użytkownik może dodać zdjęcia profilowe oraz szczegółowe informacje, które będą widoczne dla wszystkich użytkowników portalu. Nie należy podawać informacji, których użytkownik nie chce udostępniać publicznie. Kompletny profil umożliwi szybsze i łatwiejsze odnalezienie użytkownika w CivilHub.org.

2.3 Pliki cookies

CivilHub.org korzysta z plików cookie, aby poprawić jakość usług, wzmocnić bezpieczeństwo oraz w przyszłości dostarczyć reklamy sprofilowane dla użytkownika. Odwiedzając CivilHub.org użytkownik wyraża zgodę na umieszczenie plików cookie i sygnałów nawigacyjnych w swojej wyszukiwarce zgodnie z niniejszą Polityką Ochrony Prywatności.

2.4 Wyszukiwanie

Każdy użytkownik ma możliwość wyszukania informacji o innych członkach portalu, grupach, inicjatywach, lokalizacjach, pomysłach oraz dyskusjach prowadzonych w portalu.

2.5 User communication

CivilHub.org nie bierze odpowiedzialności za wysyłane treści między użytkownikami. Zastrzegamy sobie możliwość blokowania użytkowników wysyłających niechciane wiadomości (SPAM) do innych użytkowników portalu.

3. Prawa i obowiązki użytkownika

3.1 Prawo do zmiany informacji oraz usunięcie konta. Każdy zarejestrowany użytkownik posiada pełne prawo do modyfikacji, zmiany, korekty lub całkowitego usunięcia konta bez podania przyczyny. Istnieje również możliwość usunięcia konta przez administratora na prośbę użytkownika lub gdy użytkownik nie przestrzega zasad podanych w Regulaminie oraz Polityce Prywatności. W przypadku zamknięcia konta dane użytkownika zostaną usunięte w przeciągu 72 godzin. Publiczny profil użytkownika może pokazać się w wynikach wyszukiwania do czasu odświeżenia pamięci podręcznej wyszukiwarek.

Informacje podane przez użytkownika są przechowywane w chwili, gdy konto jest aktywne lub jeśli jest to niezbędne. CivilHub.org może przechowywać dane użytkownika po usunięciu konta oraz je udostępnić jeśli są one niezbędne do rozwiązania zobowiązań prawnych, wymogów prawnych, rozwiązania sporów lub wyegzekwowania Polityki Ochrony Prywatności. Okres przechowywania danych o użytkownikach zależy od wymogów prawnych.

3.3 Obowiązki użytkownika

Użytkownik powinien przestrzegać zasad i warunków zapisanych w regulaminie i polityce prywatności. Dotyczy to również praw własności intelektualnej, praw autorskich i znaków towarowych.

Użytkownik ma obowiązek zachować poufność podanego przez siebie hasła. Publikowanie informacji uważanych za obraźliwe, agresywne, rasistowskie oraz takich, które mogą naruszać cel, misję lub urazić społeczność użytkowników jest zakazane. Nie przestrzeganie przez użytkownika wyżej wymienionych zasad może prowadzić do usunięcia, zawieszenia lub zablokowania użytkownika.

4. Ważne informacje

4.1 Wiek minimalny

Jak określono w regulaminie, aby korzystać z CivilHub.org osoba fizyczna na terenie RP musi ukończyć trzynasty rok życia. Wiek minimalny do korzystania z portalu może być inny w zależności od lokalnego prawa obowiązujego w kraju, z którego użytkownik łączy się z portalem.

4.2 Bezpieczeństwo

Portal CivilHub.org wszystkie dane za wyjątkiem haseł przechowuje jako czysty tekst w bazie danych, utrzymywanej na serwerach własnych lub dzierżawionych. Dane wrażliwe w postaci haseł, są zaszyfrowane, uniemożliwiając przez to ich odczytanie.

4.3 Zmiany w polityce prywatności

CivilHub.org zobowiązuje się w przypadku wprowadzenia zmian w Polityce prywatności do niezwłocznego poinformowania wszystkich użytkoników poprzez wstawienie informacji na stronie głównej portalu. W stopce portalu będzie widoczna data ostatniej zmiany w Polityce Prywatności.

fields.title: Cookies
fields.content:
1. What are “cookies”?

CivilHub.org uses cookies to provide you with a better service while using our website. Cookies are small pieces of information sent by the web service that you visit and are stored on the device or computer you use when browsing the web. Thanks to "cookies" the use of the websites is easier and more enjoyable and your content, for example texts or photos are better suited to your needs.

2. What types of cookies do we use?

CivilHub.org uses session cookies. These are temporary files that are stored in your terminal equipment until you log out, leave the website or disable the software (web browser).

3. What are "cookies" useful for?

Cookies are used to provide you with a personalized theme of the site and to gather information about the use of the Web site. "Cookies" are commonly used to support the parties and allow for a safe browsing.

fields.content_pl:
1. Czym są piki „Cookies”?

CivilHub.org używa pików cookies (tzw. „ciasteczka”) aby zapewnić wyższą jakoś usług użytkownikom. Pliki cookies to małe pliki wysłane przez serwer z informacjami. Przechowywane są na urządzeniu, z którego korzysta użytkownik podczas przeglądania internetu. Dzięki pilkom cookies, korzystanie ze stron internetowych jest łatwiejsze i wygodniejsze, natomiast zawartość (zdjęcia czy tekst) są lepiej dostosowane do indiwidualnych potrzeb użytkownika.

2. Jakich plików cookies używamy?

CivilHub.org używa sesyjnych pilków cookies. Te pliki są czasowo przechowywane na urządzeniu końcowym do czasu wylogowania się, opuszczenia strony lub wyłączenia przeglądarki.

3. Do czego przydatne są pliki cookies?

Pliki cookies używane są celem zapewnienia użytkownikowi spersonalizowanego motywu strony oraz zebrania informacji o sposobie korzystania ze strony przez użytkownika. Pliki cookies są powszechnie stosowane aby wspomagać strony oraz aby zapewnić ich bezpieczne przeglądanie.

fields.title: Features
fields.content:
• Summary
  • Discussion
  • Ideas
  • Polls
  • Projects
  • Documents

Our inicatives

CivilHub is a community, where we can change the places we live in.

Start
1

Join the community

The place where you live. Stay in touch and observe what's happening in the places you love.

2

Vote for ideas

Express your opinion on ideas proposed by people from you local community.

3

Propose changes

You know best what should be changed in the place you live in. Share you knowledge and see how many people feel exactly the same.

Work in you city

Make changes with people from your community.

Together we can decide about our local environment.

We support such countries as:

You can read news added by your neighbours

If you have something important to communicate, write it. Everyone from your place will see it. We believe that we can inform each other about important news that concern us all.
Politics and media are often against the idea of a united society.

A discussion forum for your place

Talk about eveything you wish with people from you community.

Vote for proposed changes, propose your own

We provide you with a simple tool that allows you to create polls. You can use that information to gather information about the place you live in.

Create a local poll, see what other people think

Together we have the possibility to change the places we live in. We know best what should be changed, we simply didn't have a place where we could write about it. Let's realize our ideas together.

Ideas converted into projects.

Ideas alone won't change anything. It's the result that matters. We supply a tool that allows common people to breath life into their ideas.

Share documents with people from your surroundings

Within a homestead, town we often have a need to share certain documents that concern us all.

Here, in the future, we will also be able to create our premises to the law.

Take a look at what's happening in your environment, on a map

Each content (ideas, polls, news, discussions, places) can be marked on a map. Thanks to this map you can quickly see what exactly is happening in your place.

Ideas

View the idea that appeared in your neighbourhood. Vote for it.

Discussions

We can talk about conrete elements of our local environment.

Cards on the table - API, CC, GPL

Everyone has access to data collected in the portal. We publish a public API, every single part of the portal is licenced under the CC Creative Commons. The whole application is available on GitHub under the open GPL-3 licence.

Nie masz konta?

Utwórz nowe konto!

Zarejestruj się

fields.content_pl:
• Aktualności
  • Dyskusje
  • Pomysły
  • Ankiety
  • Projekty
  • Dokumenty

Nasze inicjatywy

CivilHub to społeczność, gdzie wspólnie możemy zmieniać miejsca, w których żyjemy.

Rozpocznij
1

Dołącz do społeczności

Do miejsc, w których mieszkasz. Bądź w kontakcie, obserwuj co się dzieję, w miejscu które kochasz.

2

Głosuj na pomysły

Wyrażaj swoją opinię na temat idei proponowanych przez osoby z twojego otoczenia.

3

Proponuj zmiany

Ty najlepiej wiesz co należy poprawić w miejscu, w którym żyjesz. Podziel się tą wiedzą i zobacz jak wiele osób myśli tak samo.

Działaj w swoim mieście

Realizuj zmiany z ludźmi mieszkającymi blisko Ciebie

Razem decydujmy o naszej wspólnej przestrzeni.

Wspieramy takie kraje jak:

Możesz czytać aktualności publikowane przez Twoich sąsiadów

Jeżeli masz coś ważnego do przekazania, napisz to. Wszyscy z Twojej okolicy to zobaczą. Wierzymy, że możemy się nawzajem informować o ważnych kwestiach dotyczących nas wszystkich.
Politykom i mediom często nie zależy na tym aby społeczeństwo się jednoczyło.

Forum dyskusyjne dla Twojego miejsca

Rozmawiaj, na każdym temat z ludźmi z Twojego otoczenia.

Głosuj na propozycję zmian, proponuj własne

Dajemy Ci proste narzędzie dzięki, któremu możesz stworzyć ankietę zbierając opinię na temat powiązany z miejscem w którym żyjesz.

Stwórz lokalną ankietę, sprawdź co myślą inni

Razem mamy możliwości zmienić miejsca, w których żyjemy. Sami wiemy najlepiej co należy zmienić, brakowało nam tylko miejsca, gdzie moglibyśmy o tym napisać. Wspólnie zrealizujmy nasze pomysły.

Pomysły przekształcamy w projekty

Same pomysły nic nie zmieniają. Liczy się konkretny efekt. Udostępniamy narzędzie dzięki, któremu zwykli obywatele mogą wspólnie wprowadzać zmiany w życie.

Dziel się dokumentami z ludzimi z twojego otoczenia

W ramach osiedla / miejscowości, często mamy potrzebę podzielenia się dokumentami / plikami, które dotyczą nas wszystkich.

Tutaj również będziemy mogli w przyszłości tworzyć nasze założenia do zmiany prawa.

Zobacz co się dzieje, w okolicy na mapie

Każdą zawartość (pomysły, ankiety, aktualności, dyskusje, lokalizacje), można oznaczyć na mapie. Dzięki temu możemy szybko odnaleźć wszystko co sie dzieje w okolicy.

Pomysły

Zobacz jaki pomysł pojawił się w Twojej okolicy. Zagłosuj i wyraź swoją opinię.

Dyskusje

Mozemy rozmawiać na temat konkretnych elementów naszej przestrzeni.

Gramy w otwarte karty - API, CC, GPL

Każdy ma dostęp do wszystkich danych zebranych w portalu. Udostępniamy publiczne API, wszystkie informacje w portalu są objęte licencją CC Creative Common. Cała aplikacja CivilHub jest dostępna na GitHub na otwartej licencji GPL-3.

Nie masz konta?

Utwórz nowe konto!

Zarejestruj się

Security
  • How is CivilHub protected?
  • Is my account safe?
  • Is my information safe?

Can I edit my content?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

No. Once created, your content cannot be changed. The possibility of content changing would allow for e. g. vote manipulation.

How do I add a new Blog news?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new blog news, go to the Blog subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find Add news and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this news is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Your News should appear in the Blog list.

How do I add a new Discussion?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new Discussion, go to the Discussion subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find New Discussion and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this Discussion is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Click Save on the bottom of the form.
  5. Your Discussion should appear in the discussion list.

How do I add a new Document?

The document section is not yet available.

How do I add a new Idea?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new Idea, go to the Ideas subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find New idea and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this Idea is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Click Save on the bottom of the form.
  5. Your Idea should appear in the Idea list.

How do I add a new Poll?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new Poll, go to the Poll subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find Create poll and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this Poll is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Click Save on the bottom of the form.
  5. Your Poll should appear in the Polls list.

How do I add new images to the Gallery?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add new Images, go to the Gallery subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find Add files and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in and click Save on the bottom of the form.
  3. Your Image should appear in the Image subsection.

Do I need to pay for CivilHub?

No. CivilHub is and always will be, completely free.

Fill in your account information

  1. To fill in your account information, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. From there you can update your information by filling in the form and clicking Save Changes on the bottom of the form.

Find a place to follow

  1. CivilHub is all about local communities. You can start off by finding the place you live in.
  2. In the top menu of any CivilHub page, click on Browse, a map should appear, choose the country you’re interested in, pick the place you want to follow and click on the Follow button next to it.
  3. You can follow any location, a country, a province, a city, a village or even a specific street.
  4. You can also find a place by using the search option next to our logo.

How do I change my language?

  1. In the footer any CivilHub page, on the left side, find and click Choose Language.
  2. From the menu that appeared, pick the language you want to use.

What are Bookmarks? How do I add Bookmarks?

  1. Bookmarks are links that allow users to easily get back to the content that they marked.
  2. Bookmarks can be found in different pages (e.g. in the Blog). They look like this: .
  3. You add Bookmarks to your Bookmark list by clicking on the icon.
  4. You can get back to your Bookmarks by clicking on the icon next to your name in any CivilHub page.

What are Tags?

Tags are keywords that allow you to filter data. Users can choose from existing tags or add new ones.

What are points? How Can I get them?

  1. Points represent the activity of each user.
  2. You get points by virtually adding any content, this includes, among others: creating polls or ideas, starting discussions, voting and commenting.
  3. Different actions grant different amounts of points. Those that require more time (e.g. creating an idea) yield more points.
  4. For a full list of points per activity Click here.

Can I log in with my other social media accounts?

  1. Yes. Go to our homepage at https://civilhub.org
  2. In the form in the middle you will find buttons that enable you to log in with your other social media accounts (e.g. connect with Facebook).
  3. We currently support: facebook, google+, twitter and linkedin.

How do I create a new account?

  1. Go to our homepage at https://civilhub.org
  2. In the form in the middle, fill in your information (name, surname, email address and password). Remember that you can also create an account by signing up with one of you social media accounts.

How do I delete my account?

Check delete my account in the user panel menu. You have 7 days to withdraw from your decision. After that period, your account will be deleted.

How do I log into CivilHub?

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/login
  2. Type in your email address, password and click Log in
  3. Log in and create an account through the use of one of the following social media account:
    • Facebook
    • Google+
    • Twitter
    • LinkedIn

How do I log out?

  1. In the top right corner of any CivilHub page click on your name.
  2. A dropdown menu will appear. Find and click the Logout button on the bottom of the menu.

I didn't get a confirmation email, what should I do?

  1. Check if our email didn’t end up in the SPAM folder of your webmail.
  2. Check whether you have correctly typed in you email address.
  3. Click resend email.
  4. Try to log in with a social media account.

I forgot my password

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/passreset
  2. Type in your email address.
  3. Write the captcha security text and click Submit.

How do I add a Map Point?

Map points are automatically added to the map if the user chooses to do so when adding an Idea, Discussion, Poll or News. Place Map Points must be added as places must refer to specific places.

How do I add a new location?

  1. When logged in, in the top menu of any CivilHub page, under Browse find Create new and click it.
  2. In the form, fill in the basic information about the place (name and description).
  3. In parent, choose the country your location is situated in, then if necessary, add a subplace (province/city/village etc.).
  4. Upload a photo if you want to. We encourage you to do so, as adding an image will make your place stand out from all the other places with the default image.

My country is not supported

Not every country is yet supported by CivilHub. If you want your country to be included, please contact us click here

What are Map Filters?

Be default, your map shows all points possible (i.e. Places, Ideas, Polls, Discussions and News). Map Filters allow you to see only those points that you want to see.

What are Map Points

Map Points enable you to see all Places, Ideas, Discussions, Polls and News on one map.

Why do points cluster up?

A map with thousands of points is unreadable from distance. When points cluster up, they allow the user to see which Places are the most active ones.

How can I see my messages?

Go to your mailbox, do so by clicking on the icon in the top right corner of any CivilHub page.

How can I write a message?

  1. Go to your mailbox, do so by clicking on the icon in the top right corner of any CivilHub page.
  2. In the left menu, click on Write.
  3. Fill in the form and click Send.

What can be found in my Archives?

Messages found in the Archives are those that you want to store for a longer period of time. These should be messages that are important. You should put unimportant messages of no bigger importance in the Trash.

What can be found in my Inbox?

The Inbox contains all the messages you have received. You can delete or archive your messages from here. Deleted messages end up in the Trash section.

What can be found in my Sent Messages?

Here you can find all the messages you have sent. You can delete or archive your messages from here. Deleted messages end up in the Trash section.

What can be found in my Trash?

  1. Messages found in the Trash are those that are of minor or no importance to you.
  2. Messages found in the Trash will be deleted periodically so don’t hold any vital messages here. Important messages should be stored in the archives.

What can be found in the Write section?

  1. Here you can write messages.
  2. If you want to send a message, fill in the form and click Send.

How can I find the mobile application for my mobile device?

No information.

How do I install the application?

No information.

Is there a mobile version of CivilHub?

No information.

What devices are supported?

No information.

Can I change all of my information?

No. You can change all of your information except for you email address.

How can I reset my password?

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/passreset
  2. Type in your email address.
  3. Write the captcha security text and click Submit.

How do I change my avatar?

  1. To change your avatar, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change avatar.
  3. Next, click on Choose picture.
  4. Pick any picture you like from your computer, crop it and click Save.

How do I change my background image?

  1. To change your background image, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change background image.
  3. Next, click on Choose picture
  4. Pick any picture you like from your computer, crop it and click Save.

How do I change my information?

  1. To change your account information, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. From there you can update your information by filling in the form and clicking Save Changes on the bottom of the form.

How do I change my password?

  1. To change your password, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change password. Fill in the form by typing in your current and new password.
  3. When you’re done, click on Save Changes.

How do I delete my account?

Check delete my account in the user panel menu. You have 7 days to withdraw from your decision. After that period, your account will be deleted.

I think someone is using my account.

If you are not sure whether your account is safe, click here and we will help you.

How do I find a place to follow?

  1. In the top menu of any CivilHub page, click on Browse, a map should appear, choose the country you’re interested in, pick the place you want to follow and click on the Follow button next to it.
  2. You can follow any location, a country, a province, a city, a village or even a specific street.
  3. You can also find a place by using the search option next to our logo.

How do I sort the content?

  1. You can sort the content by using the second menu under the place’s picture.
  2. You can sort information by type or by date.
  3. You can also filter data by the usage of tags.

How do I stop following a place?

  1. Go to the place you want to stop following.
  2. Click on the you are following button right below the name of the place in the middle of the page.
  3. A notification should appear in the right corner of the page. Additionally, the button should change to follow.

Is there a place where I can see all of my places?

  1. Yes. Click on Browse in the top menu.
  2. A dropdown menu will appear that contains all of the places that you are currently following.

What are sublocations?

Sublocations are any places smaller than a country. They can be provinces, cities, villages or streets.

What can I find in Blog?

  1. The Blog subsection provides current information concerning the place you are browsing.
  2. Examples of such blog news can include: “A new gym was opened”, “A bus stop was demolished”, “Results of the latest elections”.

What can I find in Discussions?

  1. The discussion subsection provides a place to share thoughts and ideas on a given subject. Anyone can start a discussion and everyone can join in.
  2. Examples of a discussion: "Should there be a new parking lot or a new cinema on Washington Street?", "Do we need more parks in our city?", "Should we ban cars from the city center?"

What can I find in Documents?

  1. In the Documents subsection it is possible to submit official papers, newspaper articles and other written forms.
  2. The Documents subsection allows users to upload docs and pdfs.

What can I find in Followers?

The Followers subsection contains a list of all users that are currently following a given place.

What can I find in Gallery?

  1. Gallery is a space to upload images of a given place.
  2. The Gallery subsection allows to both share beautiful pictures of a given place and also provides a space to publish images of places that may require more attention.

What can I find in Ideas?

  1. Ideas are one of the most important features of CivilHub. They allow people to unite towards a specific goal.
  2. When an idea is created people can vote whether they like it or not by clicking on Yes or No.
  3. If the idea gets enough attention and approval a project can be formed in order to implement this idea.

What can I find in Polls?

  1. Polling is a way to question your community.
  2. Polling is different from Ideas as it only examines the opinion of the people, while Ideas, on the other hand, are organized around a specific goal. Unlike in Ideas, no downvoting is allowed in Polls and several answers may be possible.

What can I find in Projects?

  1. Projects are ideas that are ready to be implemented. The opinion of the community has been heard and enough people volunteered to take part in the project.
  2. The Project subsection allows to distribute labour and organize work.

What can I find in Subspaces?

Subspaces allows you to easily see all Subspaces of a given place. That is, places that are included in a given place (e.g. a street).

What can I find in Summary?

The Summary subsection provides an overview of the latest information from all subsections i.e. News, Discussion, Ideas, Pools, Projects, Documents.

Where do I find content that interests me in my place?

While in a place, underneath the image of the place there are several subsections like Discussions, Ideas, Pools etc. Each one of them contains certain information concerning the place you are currently browsing. These subsections are described more thoroughly in other parts of this section.

How is CivilHub protected?

No information.

Is my account safe?

No information.

Is my information safe?

No information.

Can I edit my content?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

No. Once created, your content cannot be changed. The possibility of content changing would allow for e. g. vote manipulation.

How do I add a new Blog news?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new blog news, go to the Blog subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find Add news and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this news is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Your News should appear in the Blog list.

How do I add a new Discussion?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new Discussion, go to the Discussion subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find New Discussion and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this Discussion is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Click Save on the bottom of the form.
  5. Your Discussion should appear in the discussion list.

How do I add a new Document?

The document section is not yet available.

How do I add a new Idea?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new Idea, go to the Ideas subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find New idea and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this Idea is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Click Save on the bottom of the form.
  5. Your Idea should appear in the Idea list.

How do I add a new Poll?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add a new Poll, go to the Poll subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find Create poll and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in.
  3. If this Poll is about a specific location you can mark it on the map.
  4. Click Save on the bottom of the form.
  5. Your Poll should appear in the Polls list.

How do I add new images to the Gallery?

Note! In order to add new content to a place you need to be in that place. You can do that by going to the map or by finding the place you are looking for through the search bar. To see a more detailed description of how to find a place, click here.

  1. To add new Images, go to the Gallery subsection located under the place’s image and in the right sidebar, under Actions, find Add files and click it.
  2. A form should appear, fill it in and click Save on the bottom of the form.
  3. Your Image should appear in the Image subsection.

Do I need to pay for CivilHub?

No. CivilHub is and always will be, completely free.

Fill in your account information

  1. To fill in your account information, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. From there you can update your information by filling in the form and clicking Save Changes on the bottom of the form.

Find a place to follow

  1. CivilHub is all about local communities. You can start off by finding the place you live in.
  2. In the top menu of any CivilHub page, click on Browse, a map should appear, choose the country you’re interested in, pick the place you want to follow and click on the Follow button next to it.
  3. You can follow any location, a country, a province, a city, a village or even a specific street.
  4. You can also find a place by using the search option next to our logo.

How do I change my language?

  1. In the footer any CivilHub page, on the left side, find and click Choose Language.
  2. From the menu that appeared, pick the language you want to use.

What are Bookmarks? How do I add Bookmarks?

  1. Bookmarks are links that allow users to easily get back to the content that they marked.
  2. Bookmarks can be found in different pages (e.g. in the Blog). They look like this: .
  3. You add Bookmarks to your Bookmark list by clicking on the icon.
  4. You can get back to your Bookmarks by clicking on the icon next to your name in any CivilHub page.

What are Tags?

Tags are keywords that allow you to filter data. Users can choose from existing tags or add new ones.

What are points? How Can I get them?

  1. Points represent the activity of each user.
  2. You get points by virtually adding any content, this includes, among others: creating polls or ideas, starting discussions, voting and commenting.
  3. Different actions grant different amounts of points. Those that require more time (e.g. creating an idea) yield more points.
  4. For a full list of points per activity Click here.

Can I log in with my other social media accounts?

  1. Yes. Go to our homepage at https://civilhub.org
  2. In the form in the middle you will find buttons that enable you to log in with your other social media accounts (e.g. connect with Facebook).
  3. We currently support: facebook, google+, twitter and linkedin.

How do I create a new account?

  1. Go to our homepage at https://civilhub.org
  2. In the form in the middle, fill in your information (name, surname, email address and password). Remember that you can also create an account by signing up with one of you social media accounts.

How do I delete my account?

Check delete my account in the user panel menu. You have 7 days to withdraw from your decision. After that period, your account will be deleted.

How do I log into CivilHub?

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/login
  2. Type in your email address, password and click Log in
  3. Log in and create an account through the use of one of the following social media account:
    • Facebook
    • Google+
    • Twitter
    • LinkedIn

How do I log out?

  1. In the top right corner of any CivilHub page click on your name.
  2. A dropdown menu will appear. Find and click the Logout button on the bottom of the menu.

I didn't get a confirmation email, what should I do?

  1. Check if our email didn’t end up in the SPAM folder of your webmail.
  2. Check whether you have correctly typed in you email address.
  3. Click resend email.
  4. Try to log in with a social media account.

I forgot my password

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/passreset
  2. Type in your email address.
  3. Write the captcha security text and click Submit.

How do I add a Map Point?

Map points are automatically added to the map if the user chooses to do so when adding an Idea, Discussion, Poll or News. Place Map Points must be added as places must refer to specific places.

How do I add a new location?

  1. When logged in, in the top menu of any CivilHub page, under Browse find Create new and click it.
  2. In the form, fill in the basic information about the place (name and description).
  3. In parent, choose the country your location is situated in, then if necessary, add a subplace (province/city/village etc.).
  4. Upload a photo if you want to. We encourage you to do so, as adding an image will make your place stand out from all the other places with the default image.

My country is not supported

Not every country is yet supported by CivilHub. If you want your country to be included, please contact us click here

What are Map Filters?

Be default, your map shows all points possible (i.e. Places, Ideas, Polls, Discussions and News). Map Filters allow you to see only those points that you want to see.

What are Map Points

Map Points enable you to see all Places, Ideas, Discussions, Polls and News on one map.

Why do points cluster up?

A map with thousands of points is unreadable from distance. When points cluster up, they allow the user to see which Places are the most active ones.

How can I see my messages?

Go to your mailbox, do so by clicking on the icon in the top right corner of any CivilHub page.

How can I write a message?

  1. Go to your mailbox, do so by clicking on the icon in the top right corner of any CivilHub page.
  2. In the left menu, click on Write.
  3. Fill in the form and click Send.

What can be found in my Archives?

Messages found in the Archives are those that you want to store for a longer period of time. These should be messages that are important. You should put unimportant messages of no bigger importance in the Trash.

What can be found in my Inbox?

The Inbox contains all the messages you have received. You can delete or archive your messages from here. Deleted messages end up in the Trash section.

What can be found in my Sent Messages?

Here you can find all the messages you have sent. You can delete or archive your messages from here. Deleted messages end up in the Trash section.

What can be found in my Trash?

  1. Messages found in the Trash are those that are of minor or no importance to you.
  2. Messages found in the Trash will be deleted periodically so don’t hold any vital messages here. Important messages should be stored in the archives.

What can be found in the Write section?

  1. Here you can write messages.
  2. If you want to send a message, fill in the form and click Send.

How can I find the mobile application for my mobile device?

No information.

How do I install the application?

No information.

Is there a mobile version of CivilHub?

No information.

What devices are supported?

No information.

Can I change all of my information?

No. You can change all of your information except for you email address.

How can I reset my password?

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/passreset
  2. Type in your email address.
  3. Write the captcha security text and click Submit.

How do I change my avatar?

  1. To change your avatar, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change avatar.
  3. Next, click on Choose picture.
  4. Pick any picture you like from your computer, crop it and click Save.

How do I change my background image?

  1. To change your background image, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change background image.
  3. Next, click on Choose picture
  4. Pick any picture you like from your computer, crop it and click Save.

How do I change my information?

  1. To change your account information, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. From there you can update your information by filling in the form and clicking Save Changes on the bottom of the form.

How do I change my password?

  1. To change your password, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change password. Fill in the form by typing in your current and new password.
  3. When you’re done, click on Save Changes.

How do I delete my account?

Check delete my account in the user panel menu. You have 7 days to withdraw from your decision. After that period, your account will be deleted.

I think someone is using my account.

If you are not sure whether your account is safe, click here and we will help you.

How do I find a place to follow?

  1. In the top menu of any CivilHub page, click on Browse, a map should appear, choose the country you’re interested in, pick the place you want to follow and click on the Follow button next to it.
  2. You can follow any location, a country, a province, a city, a village or even a specific street.
  3. You can also find a place by using the search option next to our logo.

How do I sort the content?

  1. You can sort the content by using the second menu under the place’s picture.
  2. You can sort information by type or by date.
  3. You can also filter data by the usage of tags.

How do I stop following a place?

  1. Go to the place you want to stop following.
  2. Click on the you are following button right below the name of the place in the middle of the page.
  3. A notification should appear in the right corner of the page. Additionally, the button should change to follow.

Is there a place where I can see all of my places?

  1. Yes. Click on Browse in the top menu.
  2. A dropdown menu will appear that contains all of the places that you are currently following.

What are sublocations?

Sublocations are any places smaller than a country. They can be provinces, cities, villages or streets.

What can I find in Blog?

  1. The Blog subsection provides current information concerning the place you are browsing.
  2. Examples of such blog news can include: “A new gym was opened”, “A bus stop was demolished”, “Results of the latest elections”.

What can I find in Discussions?

  1. The discussion subsection provides a place to share thoughts and ideas on a given subject. Anyone can start a discussion and everyone can join in.
  2. Examples of a discussion: "Should there be a new parking lot or a new cinema on Washington Street?", "Do we need more parks in our city?", "Should we ban cars from the city center?"

What can I find in Documents?

  1. In the Documents subsection it is possible to submit official papers, newspaper articles and other written forms.
  2. The Documents subsection allows users to upload docs and pdfs.

What can I find in Followers?

The Followers subsection contains a list of all users that are currently following a given place.

What can I find in Gallery?

  1. Gallery is a space to upload images of a given place.
  2. The Gallery subsection allows to both share beautiful pictures of a given place and also provides a space to publish images of places that may require more attention.

What can I find in Ideas?

  1. Ideas are one of the most important features of CivilHub. They allow people to unite towards a specific goal.
  2. When an idea is created people can vote whether they like it or not by clicking on Yes or No.
  3. If the idea gets enough attention and approval a project can be formed in order to implement this idea.

What can I find in Polls?

  1. Polling is a way to question your community.
  2. Polling is different from Ideas as it only examines the opinion of the people, while Ideas, on the other hand, are organized around a specific goal. Unlike in Ideas, no downvoting is allowed in Polls and several answers may be possible.

What can I find in Projects?

  1. Projects are ideas that are ready to be implemented. The opinion of the community has been heard and enough people volunteered to take part in the project.
  2. The Project subsection allows to distribute labour and organize work.

What can I find in Subspaces?

Subspaces allows you to easily see all Subspaces of a given place. That is, places that are included in a given place (e.g. a street).

What can I find in Summary?

The Summary subsection provides an overview of the latest information from all subsections i.e. News, Discussion, Ideas, Pools, Projects, Documents.

Where do I find content that interests me in my place?

While in a place, underneath the image of the place there are several subsections like Discussions, Ideas, Pools etc. Each one of them contains certain information concerning the place you are currently browsing. These subsections are described more thoroughly in other parts of this section.

How is CivilHub protected?

No information.

Is my account safe?

No information.

Is my information safe?

No information.

  4. Try to log in with a social media account.

I forgot my password

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/passreset
  2. Type in your email address.
  3. Write the captcha security text and click Submit.

How do I add a Map Point?

Map points are automatically added to the map if the user chooses to do so when adding an Idea, Discussion, Poll or News. Place Map Points must be added as places must refer to specific places.

How do I add a new location?

  1. When logged in, in the top menu of any CivilHub page, under Browse find Create new and click it.
  2. In the form, fill in the basic information about the place (name and description).
  3. In parent, choose the country your location is situated in, then if necessary, add a subplace (province/city/village etc.).
  4. Upload a photo if you want to. We encourage you to do so, as adding an image will make your place stand out from all the other places with the default image.

My country is not supported

Not every country is yet supported by CivilHub. If you want your country to be included, please contact us click here

What are Map Filters?

Be default, your map shows all points possible (i.e. Places, Ideas, Polls, Discussions and News). Map Filters allow you to see only those points that you want to see.

What are Map Points

Map Points enable you to see all Places, Ideas, Discussions, Polls and News on one map.

Why do points cluster up?

A map with thousands of points is unreadable from distance. When points cluster up, they allow the user to see which Places are the most active ones.

How can I see my messages?

Go to your mailbox, do so by clicking on the icon in the top right corner of any CivilHub page.

How can I write a message?

  1. Go to your mailbox, do so by clicking on the icon in the top right corner of any CivilHub page.
  2. In the left menu, click on Write.
  3. Fill in the form and click Send.

What can be found in my Archives?

Messages found in the Archives are those that you want to store for a longer period of time. These should be messages that are important. You should put unimportant messages of no bigger importance in the Trash.

What can be found in my Inbox?

The Inbox contains all the messages you have received. You can delete or archive your messages from here. Deleted messages end up in the Trash section.

What can be found in my Sent Messages?

Here you can find all the messages you have sent. You can delete or archive your messages from here. Deleted messages end up in the Trash section.

What can be found in my Trash?

  1. Messages found in the Trash are those that are of minor or no importance to you.
  2. Messages found in the Trash will be deleted periodically so don’t hold any vital messages here. Important messages should be stored in the archives.

What can be found in the Write section?

  1. Here you can write messages.
  2. If you want to send a message, fill in the form and click Send.

How can I find the mobile application for my mobile device?

No information.

How do I install the application?

No information.

Is there a mobile version of CivilHub?

No information.

What devices are supported?

No information.

Can I change all of my information?

No. You can change all of your information except for you email address.

How can I reset my password?

  1. Go to https://civilhub.org/user/passreset
  2. Type in your email address.
  3. Write the captcha security text and click Submit.

How do I change my avatar?

  1. To change your avatar, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change avatar.
  3. Next, click on Choose picture.
  4. Pick any picture you like from your computer, crop it and click Save.

How do I change my background image?

  1. To change your background image, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change background image.
  3. Next, click on Choose picture
  4. Pick any picture you like from your computer, crop it and click Save.

How do I change my information?

  1. To change your account information, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. From there you can update your information by filling in the form and clicking Save Changes on the bottom of the form.

How do I change my password?

  1. To change your password, go to https://civilhub.org/user or get there manually - click on your name in the top right corner and in the dropdown menu find Edit profile and click on it.
  2. In the left menu choose Change password. Fill in the form by typing in your current and new password.
  3. When you’re done, click on Save Changes.

How do I delete my account?

Check delete my account in the user panel menu. You have 7 days to withdraw from your decision. After that period, your account will be deleted.

I think someone is using my account.

If you are not sure whether your account is safe, click here and we will help you.

How do I find a place to follow?

  1. In the top menu of any CivilHub page, click on Browse, a map should appear, choose the country you’re interested in, pick the place you want to follow and click on the Follow button next to it.
  2. You can follow any location, a country, a province, a city, a village or even a specific street.
  3. You can also find a place by using the search option next to our logo.

How do I sort the content?

  1. You can sort the content by using the second menu under the place’s picture.
  2. You can sort information by type or by date.
  3. You can also filter data by the usage of tags.

How do I stop following a place?

  1. Go to the place you want to stop following.
  2. Click on the you are following button right below the name of the place in the middle of the page.
  3. A notification should appear in the right corner of the page. Additionally, the button should change to follow.

Is there a place where I can see all of my places?

  1. Yes. Click on Browse in the top menu.
  2. A dropdown menu will appear that contains all of the places that you are currently following.

What are sublocations?

Sublocations are any places smaller than a country. They can be provinces, cities, villages or streets.

What can I find in Blog?

  1. The Blog subsection provides current information concerning the place you are browsing.
  2. Examples of such blog news can include: “A new gym was opened”, “A bus stop was demolished”, “Results of the latest elections”.

What can I find in Discussions?

  1. The discussion subsection provides a place to share thoughts and ideas on a given subject. Anyone can start a discussion and everyone can join in.
  2. Examples of a discussion: "Should there be a new parking lot or a new cinema on Washington Street?", "Do we need more parks in our city?", "Should we ban cars from the city center?"

What can I find in Documents?

  1. In the Documents subsection it is possible to submit official papers, newspaper articles and other written forms.
  2. The Documents subsection allows users to upload docs and pdfs.

What can I find in Followers?

The Followers subsection contains a list of all users that are currently following a given place.

What can I find in Gallery?

  1. Gallery is a space to upload images of a given place.
  2. The Gallery subsection allows to both share beautiful pictures of a given place and also provides a space to publish images of places that may require more attention.

What can I find in Ideas?

  1. Ideas are one of the most important features of CivilHub. They allow people to unite towards a specific goal.
  2. When an idea is created people can vote whether they like it or not by clicking on Yes or No.
  3. If the idea gets enough attention and approval a project can be formed in order to implement this idea.

What can I find in Polls?

  1. Polling is a way to question your community.
  2. Polling is different from Ideas as it only examines the opinion of the people, while Ideas, on the other hand, are organized around a specific goal. Unlike in Ideas, no downvoting is allowed in Polls and several answers may be possible.

What can I find in Projects?

  1. Projects are ideas that are ready to be implemented. The opinion of the community has been heard and enough people volunteered to take part in the project.
  2. The Project subsection allows to distribute labour and organize work.

What can I find in Subspaces?

Subspaces allows you to easily see all Subspaces of a given place. That is, places that are included in a given place (e.g. a street).

What can I find in Summary?

The Summary subsection provides an overview of the latest information from all subsections i.e. News, Discussion, Ideas, Pools, Projects, Documents.

Where do I find content that interests me in my place?

While in a place, underneath the image of the place there are several subsections like Discussions, Ideas, Pools etc. Each one of them contains certain information concerning the place you are currently browsing. These subsections are described more thoroughly in other parts of this section.

How is CivilHub protected?

No information.

Is my account safe?

No information.

Is my information safe?

No information.
